intro: Xerocarpus abyssinicus, commonly known as the Abyssinian sandmat, is a perennial shrub native to the arid regions of Ethiopia. It is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit and grayish-blue foliage, which helps it conserve moisture in hot, dry climates. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer, adding a delicate ornamental touch. Its fibrous roots allow it to thrive in poor, well-drained soils, making it well adapted to harsh environments. Xerocarpus abyssinicus is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ability to stabilize soil in sandy or rocky areas.
